DataElement.preferredName: HIV 1 And/Or HCV FDA Approval Nucleic Acid Amplification Test Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not an FDA approved nucleic acid amplification test for HIV-1 and/or HCV was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: HIV 1 And/Or HCV FDA Approval Nucleic Acid Amplification Test Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The type species of lentivirus and the etiologic agent of acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). It is characterized by its cytopathic effect and affinity for the T4-lymphocyte._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame._One of the agencies of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. It assures the safety of foods and cosmetics, and the safety and efficacy of pharmaceuticals, biological products, radiation emitting products, medical devices, and also, animal feed and drugs._Approved; established by authority; given authoritative approval._Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of microorganism contamination in blood. It is most frequently used to detect recent viral infection in individuals during the latency period before seroconversion but can also be used to detect other types of blood contamination._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus 1 And/Or Hepatitis C Virus Food and Drug Administration Approval Nucleic Acid Amplification Test
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The type species of lentivirus and the etiologic agent of acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). It is characterized by its cytopathic effect and affinity for the T4-lymphocyte.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame.:One of the agencies of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. It assures the safety of foods and cosmetics, and the safety and efficacy of pharmaceuticals, biological products, radiation emitting products, medical devices, and also, animal feed and drugs.:Approved; established by authority; given authoritative approval.:Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of microorganism contamination in blood. It is most frequently used to detect recent viral infection in individuals during the latency period before seroconversion but can also be used to detect other types of blood contamination.

Concepts.definition: Any viral organism that can be assigned to the species Human Immunodeficiency virus 1.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame.

One of the agencies of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. It assures the safety of foods and cosmetics, and the safety and efficacy of pharmaceuticals, biological products, radiation emitting products, medical devices, and also, animal feed and drugs.
Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.

Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of virus contamination in donor blood.  Specifically designed to detect recently infected individuals during the latency period before seroconversion.
Executed and carried through to completion.
